main event: A ground-radar tracked an unidentified stationary object at 18,000 feet near Baker, Oregon on July 16, 1963.
interesting points: The object was observed for 5 minutes and gained altitude during that time.
Air control confirmed there were no aircraft in the area, and the object was not a balloon.
The object appeared to be stationary when first sighted, then gradually diminished in size and became very small.
The object had a constant light and was described as a disc-shaped object 30-40 feet in diameter and 10-12 feet thick.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force and investigated, but no definitive identification of the object was made.
